did.unittitle: Relief Fund for the Relief of the Widows, Orphans and other Sufferers by the Avondale Mine Calamity records

bioghist.p: The mining disaster at the Avondale Mines near Plymouth, Luzerne County, Pennsylvania, occurred on September 6, 1869, resulting in the loss of nearly one hundred lives. On September 9, George H. Stuart was appointed by the General Committee to act as Treasurer for the collection of funds in aid of the sufferers. By November 23, the relief fund had reached the sum of $35,643.24.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of an account book with newspaper clippings regarding the disaster at the Avondale Mines and the Relief Fund set up to aid the dependents of the victims of the disaster. The volume includes a list of donors and amounts given, receipts for moneys paid out of the fund, newspaper reports about fundraising and donors, and a newspaper report on a meeting of the fund's Board of Directors. Clippings are taken from the Philadelphia Inquirer, the Philadelphia Public Ledger, the Bulletin, and the Scranton Morning Republican.
